initial.valueString: This consent form describes a research study, what you may expect if you decide to take part and important information to help you make your decision.  Please read this form carefully and ask questions about anything that is not clear before you agree to participate.  You may take this consent form home to think about and discuss with family or friends.

item.definition: What is involved in the study?
item.text: What is involved in the study?

item.definition: Will there be compensation for participation?
item.text: Will there be compensation for participation?

item.definition: What types of visits or milestones will I be compensated for?
item.text: What types of visits or milestones will I be compensated for?

item.definition: How many visits or milestones of this type will there be compensation for?
item.text: How many visits or milestones of this type will there be compensation for?

item.definition: How much will be paid per this type of visit or milestone?
item.text: How much will be paid per this type of visit or milestone?

item.definition: What are the costs of participation, if any?
item.text: What are the costs of participation, if any?

item.definition: Will there be reimbursement for other study visit costs incurred?
item.text: Will there be reimbursement for other study visit costs incurred?

item.definition: Who will pay for medical treatment if research related injury occurs?
item.text: Who will pay for medical treatment if research related injury occurs?

valueCoding.display: Acute but not chronic injury covered

item.definition: Participant Rights and whom to contact for answers
item.text: Participant Rights and whom to contact for answers

item.definition: What are the rights of a participant?
item.text: What are the rights of a participant?

initial.valueString: Participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the participant is otherwise entitled, and the participant may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefitsto which the participant is otherwise entitled.

item.definition: What are the anticipated circumstances under which participant's participation may be terminated by the investigator without regard to the participant's or the legally authorized representative's consent.
item.text: What are the anticipated circumstances under which participant's participation may be terminated by the investigator without regard to the participant's or the legally authorized representative's consent.

item.definition: Are there consequences for early withdrawal?
item.text: Are there consequences for early withdrawal?

item.definition: Are there Emotional Consequences of Withdrawal?
item.text: Are there Emotional Consequences of Withdrawal

item.definition: Are there Physical Consequences of Withdrawal?
item.text: Are there Physical Consequences of Withdrawal

item.definition: What are the consequences of withdrawal?
item.text: What are the consequences of withdrawal?

initial.valueString: Medical information and billing records are protected by the privacy regulations of the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA).  This type of information is called protected health information (PHI).PHI about you may be obtained from any hospital, doctor, and other health care provider involved in your care.

item.definition: Are there data security or policies that need to be included in the consent, particularly around device use (optional)
item.text: Are there data security or policies that need to be included in the consent, particularly around device use (optional)

item.definition: Describe any data security policies and processes protecting the data
item.text: Describe any data security policies and processes protecting the data

item.definition: Who can use or see participant information?
item.text: Who can use or see participant information?

item.definition: Role or group who will have access to data
item.text: Role or group who will have access to data

valueCoding.display: Researchers outside the study team at this institution

item.definition: Will the data be released for future use?
item.text: Will the data be released for future use?

item.definition: Will the future use data be deidentified?
item.text: Will the future use data be deidentified?

item.definition: Required text disclosure surrounding future use.
item.text: Required text disclosure surrounding future use.

valueCoding.display: Identifiers might be removed from private information or biospecimens, and this information could then be used for future research studies or distributed to another investigator for future research studies without additional informed consent.
Information or biospeciments collected will not be used or distributed for future research studies, even if deidentified.

item.definition: Were specimens collected as part of this study?
item.text: Were specimens collected as part of this study?

item.definition: Is whole genome sequencing being conducted?
item.text: Is whole genome sequencing being conducted?

item.definition: Sharing or no Sharing of samples.
item.text: Sharing or no Sharing of samples.

item.definition: Will participant share in profit with commerical use?
item.text: Will participant share in profit with commerical use?

item.definition: Indicator if revocation of sample consent is an option
item.text: Can consent for sample use be revoked?

item.definition: Will there be Broad Consent for Storage, maintenance and secondary research use?
item.text: Will there be Broad Consent for Storage, maintenance and secondary research use?

If selected, participant identifiable information and identifiable biospecimens will be stored, used and shared for the kinds of future research described in this broad consent form, without anyone asking your permission for each new study.  Identifying information may also be removed from your information and biospecimens, allowing them to be used for any future research or other purpose.
Can the study team contact you for future research?

item.definition: Conditions about contact for additional sample use, information not currently described or future research
item.text: Conditions about contact for additional sample use, information not currently described or future research

item.definition: Will participants share or not share in commercial profit?
item.text: Will participants share or not share in commercial profit?

item.definition: Reasons why participants will or will not share in commerical profit
item.text: Reasons why participants will or will not share in commerical profit

item.definition: Will the study team contact you with new information that may affect your willingness to remain in the stu
item.text: Will the study team contact you with new information that may affect your willingness to remain in the study

item.definition: Will the study team disclose clinically relevant study results to you
item.text: Will the study team disclose clinically relevant study results to you?

item.definition: Condtions under which the study results will be disclosed to you
item.text: Condtions under which the study results will be disclosed to you

initial.valueString: A description of this clinical trial will be available on http://www.ClinicalTrials.gov, as required by U.S. Law. This Web site will not include information that can identify you. At most, the Web site will include a summary of the results. You can search this Web site at any time.

item.definition: Is this study covered under a Certificate of Confidentiality? (default Y in NIH)
item.text: Is this study covered under a Certificate of Confidentiality? (default Y in NIH)

initial.valueString: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) has issued a Certificate of Confidentiality to further protect your privacy. With this Certificate, the investigators may not disclose research information that may identify you in any Federal, State, or local civil, criminal, administrative, legislative, or other proceedings, unless you have consented for this use.[trunc]

item.definition: Section to detail any required disclosures
item.text: Required Disclosures based on state law

item.definition: When will the PHI Authorization Expire
item.text: When will the PHI Authorization Expire based on date or time past an event

initial.valueString: Particpants have the ability to revoke their consent to share PHI at any time but that there are limitations on what restrictions can apply to data that has already been shared.
